question: Yield strength of Fe 550D 16mm?

retrieved_documents.title: Fe 550D 16mm specifications
retrieved_documents.text: Yield Strength: 565 N/mm² (per IS 1786:2008).

retrieved_documents.title: Fe 500 vs Fe 550D comparison
retrieved_documents.text: Fe 550D has higher yield strength (565 N/mm² vs 500 N/mm²), better ductility (minimum elongation 14.5% vs 12%), and enhanced weldability, making it suitable for seismic zones as per IS 13920. Fe 500 is standard grade for general construction. Fe 550D has approximately 8-10% price premium over Fe 500.

retrieved_documents.title: Fe 550D tensile strength specifications
retrieved_documents.text: Minimum tensile strength: 585 N/mm² as per IS 1786:2008. Tensile to yield ratio: minimum 1.08.
